intro: Hedyotis vestita var. lutescens, commonly known as the golden-stemmed inchplant, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant features slender, often hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged oppositely. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with white or yellow petals, and it produces small, round berries as fruit. This variant is distinguished by its yellowish stems and foliage, setting it apart from other varieties of Hedyotis.
